0: I keep feeling on edge lately, like something bad is about to happen even when everything is fine.
My heart races, my hands shake, and I can't focus whenever I have to talk to someone new.
I overthink every tiny thing I say to people and then replay it in my head for hours.
Crowded places make me feel trapped, and all I want to do is run away.
Before any exam or meeting I get this knot in my stomach that just won't go away.
1: Some days I feel unstoppable, barely sleep, and start a dozen projects, then suddenly crash for days.
I get these intense bursts of energy where everything feels possible, then I spiral into regret afterward.
There are weeks when I talk super fast and make big plans, then later I can't understand what I was thinking.
My mood keeps swinging between feeling like a genius and feeling like a complete failure.
Sometimes I spend way too much money or make impulsive decisions and only realise how risky it was later.
2: Lately nothing feels enjoyable, even the things I used to love.
It's getting harder to get out of bed, and most days I just feel emotionally numb.
I feel like I'm constantly tired, even when I sleep enough.
I keep thinking that everyone would be better off without me, even if I don't want to do anything extreme.
I feel like I'm just going through the motions without really being present.
3: I have to check the door multiple times before I can leave, or I feel something bad will happen.
My mind gets stuck on certain thoughts and I can't move on until I repeat a ritual.
I keep washing my hands over and over because they never feel clean enough.
If I don't arrange things in a specific order, I feel incredibly uncomfortable.
I get disturbing intrusive thoughts that don't match my values, but they keep coming back.
4: Sometimes I feel like people are watching me or talking about me even when I'm alone.
I hear voices commenting on what I'm doing, but nobody else seems to hear them.
I get the sense that messages on TV or online are secretly directed at me.
I feel like my thoughts aren't fully private, as if someone could read or influence them.
It's hard to tell whether some of my experiences are real or just in my head, and that scares me.
